result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Lee Teresinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with any other sentence.
Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation and has obtained a high school diploma or equivalent.

Full-time work/school (minimum of 20 hours of work per week if in school). 
Work on obtaining a HS diploma/GED/HSED.

Obtain a valid driver's license. 
Complete 8 hours of in person driver's education.

Provide DNA sample.
Court waived the DNA surcharge on this case due to a finding of indigency.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all other court costs, fees, and surcharges by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 
Court set restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Lee Teresinski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Lee Teresinski in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Daniel Lee Teresinski.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing hearing.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional statement made by Yiomaris C. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 7 days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 3: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence. 

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 20 hours of work per week if in school). 
- Work on obtaining a HS diploma/GED/HSED. 
- Complete 25 hours of community service. 
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- Complete 8 hours of in person driver's education. 

*Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation and has obtained a high school diploma or equivalent. 
*Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation. 

Court set restitution at zero.  Court waived the DNA surcharge on this case due to a finding of indigency.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all other court costs, fees, and surcharges by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given. Firearm and voting warnings given.

Defendant Daniel Lee Teresinski in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Case adjourned for sentencing and restitution hearing in Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Daniel Lee Teresinski in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Samuel Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court accepts defendant's pending misdemeanor case for global resolution.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Lee Teresinski in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Grace M. Gall appeared for Samuel Simpson for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court rescheduled scheduling conference upon request from the State.  Parties notified of new date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Daniel Lee Teresinski in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Daniel Lee Teresinski in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Daniel Lee Teresinski in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Lee Teresinski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
